internal.content: --- title: "Install CP4WAIOPS" --- ### Creating the CP4WAIOPS Instance In this chapter you will install CP4WAIOPS ## üöÄ TASK: Create the CP4WAIOPS Instance üåè Documentation for the Task: Online starter installation of CP4WAIOPS ![image](./../images/54_aimanager_story.png) Now it's time to create the CP4WAIOPS Instance by creating the `Installation` resource. To do this create an instance of the CP4WAIOPS `Installation` Custom Resource called `ibm-cp-watson-aiops` with `size: small` as we'll use this only for the training and not for production (see note below). 1. Run the following command to create an instance of CP4WAIOPS. ```yaml cat << EOF | oc apply -f - apiVersion: orchestrator.aiops.ibm.com/v1alpha1 kind: Installation metadata: name: ibm-cp-watson-aiops namespace: cp4waiops spec: enableConnectionModule: true imagePullSecret: ibm-entitlement-key license: accept: true pakModules: - name: aiopsFoundation enabled: true - name: applicationManager enabled: true - name: aiManager enabled: true - name: connection enabled: true size: small storageClass: ibmc-file-gold-gid storageClassLargeBlock: ibmc-block-gold EOF ``` This creates the `Installation` instance that the Operator will pick up and start the installation. 1. Run the following command to create an instance of CP4WAIOPS. ```yaml cat << EOF | oc apply -f - apiVersion: orchestrator.aiops.ibm.com/v1alpha1 kind: Installation metadata: name: ibm-cp-watson-aiops namespace: cp4waiops spec: enableConnectionModule: true imagePullSecret: ibm-entitlement-key license: accept: true pakModules: - name: aiopsFoundation enabled: true - name: applicationManager enabled: true - name: aiManager enabled: true - name: connection enabled: true size: small storageClass: ocs-storagecluster-cephfs storageClassLargeBlock: ocs-storagecluster-ceph-rbd EOF ``` This creates the `Installation` instance that the Operator will pick up and start the installation. **Important - This takes up to 90 minutes** This takes some time depending on what region of ROKS you have chosen. Wait for the installation to complete before continuing. The next step explains how to follow the installation progress. **Warning - This works only on IBM ROKS** If you want to install on another platform you will have to adapt storageClass and storageClassLargeBlock to your available storage classes. **Note - This is only for non-production installations** If you want to install CP4WAIOPS for production use please follow the documentation and make sure that you use `size: large`, as well as a recommended storage provider. See here: Online production installation of IBM Cloud Pak for Watson AIOps CP4WAIOPS
